peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I identify old buttons?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
To identify the age of a metal button, look at the back. If the shank is a twisted wire that's embedded in the metal, (lower left) it's probably manufactured before 1918 and considered an "antique" button.
Jan 27, 2014
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Welcome to the World of Buttons! - Mitzi's Miscellany - Typepad

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you identify old flat buttons?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Flat button vintage colonial metal button identification can easily be done from the back by looking at the seam. Sometimes, military, political or other official buttons from this time period could have a rim, or the centre could be formed around a pin.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Flat Button Vintage Colonial Metal Buttons Identification [Details]

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is there any value in old buttons?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: While family heirlooms often seem strictly sentimental, a complete antique button collection could be worth more than a seller would have ever imagined. Antique buttons are highly collectible and can be quite valuable.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Sell Vintage & Antique Buttons | Sell a Button Collection | Lion & Unicorn

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can you tell if a button up is vintage?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
HOW TO TELL IF SOMETHING IS TRUE VINTAGE
Look at the logo on the tag. If you don't recognize the brand name, it might be vintage.
Flip the label over to see where the garment was made.
Check the fabric composition tag.
Look for unique construction details and/or handmade sew jobs.
Check for a metal zipper.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How to Tell if Something is Vintage: 5 Ways to Identify Vintage Clothing
